nodes.description: 17 August evening: A suicide attacker detonated explosives at Shahr-e-Dubai Wedding Hall in West Kabul during a Shia wedding ceremony with ~1,000 attendees
nodes.support_text: On the evening of 17 August, a suicide attacker detonated explosives in the Shahr-e-Dubai Wedding Hall in West Kabul where approximately 1,000 people were gathered for a Shia wedding ceremony.

nodes.description: Initial reports indicate scores of civilians killed and many injured, including women and children
nodes.support_text: initial reports indicate killed scores of civilians and injured many more, among them women and children

nodes.description: UNAMA's human rights team begins investigating the incident to establish facts
nodes.support_text: UNAMA’s human rights team is looking into the incident and working to establish facts

nodes.description: UN Secretary-General's Special Representative Tadamichi Yamamoto condemns the attack as a cowardly act of terror targeting civilians
nodes.support_text: An attack deliberately targeting civilians is an outrage, and deeply troubling, as it can only be described as a cowardly act of terror

nodes.description: Yamamoto emphasizes attacks spread fear among already suffering population and calls for strengthened protections
nodes.support_text: The pace of such atrocious attacks indicates that current measures in place to protect must be strengthened

nodes.description: Attack occurred in predominantly Shia Muslim populated area with documented history of similar targeted attacks
nodes.support_text: The wedding hall where the attack took place is situated in an area of the city heavily populated by Afghanistan’s Shia Muslim minority. UNAMA has documented several previous attacks deliberately carried out against this community.

nodes.description: Yamamoto demands justice for organizers of attacks and accountability measures
nodes.support_text: those who have organized and enabled such attacks must be brought to justice and held to account

nodes.description: UN declares solidarity with Afghans and commitment to Afghan-led peace process ending war and achieving lasting peace
nodes.support_text: The United Nations stands with all Afghans in solidarity and remains committed to an Afghan-led peace process that will end the war and bring about a lasting peace.

nodes.description: UN offers condolences to families of victims and wishes recovery for injured
nodes.support_text: The United Nations extends deep condolences to families who lost loved ones and wishes a quick recovery to those injured.
